definition: to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk

sentences.english: You're stronger than you look with a smart ass mouth to match.
sentences.chinese: 你比看上去要强大，还有张会耍嘴皮子的臭嘴。

sentences.english: Nobody will believe you, and it won't do you any good except maybe to vent a bit.
sentences.chinese: 没有人会相信你，耍嘴皮子对你没有任何好处。

sentences.english: Just don't expect to have it with a clerk.
sentences.chinese: 不过别指望可以找个店员就此耍耍嘴皮子。

definition: to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
